Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Flat-based bowl with a flared S-shaped body and a protruding lip in continuation of the body of the vessel. The clay is common, buff-coloured, polished and partially covered with white paint. This very crude vessel (the bottom was not finished) may have had only a funerary function.
